message: I'll be honest - this phone has blown me away. If somebody were asking me what kind of smartphone to get that wasn't an iPhone, I would definitely recommend it. Certainly over Android. It's really, really awesome. And I never thought I would ever say that about a Microsoft product.
Is there an iPod touch-equivalent yet? #repeatquestion
hah. no. that does not exist anywhere.
What makes it better than Android?
I consider Windows Phone 7 and Xbox to the be only truly impressive things MS has done recently
@ericflo from my brief usage, Windows Phone 7 offers a much more refined and appealing experience
but then I'm biased against both Linux and Java from years of torture and pain, so Android's already behind in my book ;-)
Oh right - X Box. Yeah, that's fucking awesome too.
@ericflo It's really something that just has to be experienced side by side. With these things it's all about the UI, I feel, and Windows Phone 7 is honestly really good.
What is this? Eflo, Maguire, it is too soon for advertising.
@emad Look, they're paying me A LOT OF MONEY
Windows Phone is def better than Android
@mtrichardson I never thought you'd ever say that about a Microsoft product, either. :)
Is it good enough that I should go in now, or should I wait for the next generation?  (I do not own either an iPhone or iPad, so that's irrelevant...)
Looking forward to checking out the Win7 phone. I think we're getting some delivered to mess around with at work.
